description.narrative: West Indian Ocean Cable Company Ltd. (WIOCC or the Company) was incorporated in 2007 and is an existing IFC client. The Company is a carrier of carriers, offering connectivity to over 20 countries in Africa. It provides telecommunication carriers with regional and international capacity within, into and out of Africa. The IFC investment is expected to be used to fund the Companys working capital and capital expenditure requirements during FY20 to FY21 (the Project).

The Project is expected to increase the capacity of broadband networks by upgrading its submarine and terrestrial cables in response to COVID-19. IFC expects the Project to help promote greater market resilience by enabling retail network operators maintain access to and quality of digital connectivity during the crisis. IFC is providing access to new long-term financing that is not readily available in today's market as a result of COVID. The pandemic induced large outflows of capital from emerging markets, including several African countries served by the Company, with delayed access to finance, particularly for the Company.
